div.p: 012-035, Field Naturalists Club of Victoria, Melbourne.

I need not say, dear Mr Best, that I will be happy to see the members of the Field-Naturalists Club at the "Herbarium"; and as you wish me to mention an afternoon of Saturday in July, I would suggest that of the 21st. It would be well, to mention, in the Circular not Museum but "Herbarium", — because a real botanic Museum was never formed for the general public; that portion of my collection, which was to commence the Museum of vegetable products, having gone to the technologic Museum in 1867; so that only one room since 1857 remained ever since for Museum-purposes, and that contains the "herbarium".
I shall be personally in attendance on the Members of the Club, if the 21. July should prove a convenient day for their meeting.
